intro: Martinezia roezlii, commonly known as the Mexican snowberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible and often consumed by birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
